rationale: Balanced readability atlas with clean retro RPG silhouettes.
prompt:
Pixel-art sprite atlas for a 2D game showing four casted magic spells, each as a 6-frame animation strip.
Subject: Fireball, lightning strike, ice spike, poison cloud.
Environment: Transparent background, no scene backdrop, atlas-only output.
Style: 32x32 per frame, crisp pixel art, SNES-era action RPG readability.
Composition: Single image atlas arranged as 4 rows x 6 columns; row 1 fireball, row 2 lightning strike, row 3 ice spike, row 4 poison cloud; 1px transparent padding between frames.
Lighting: Emissive spell glow with controlled contrast so silhouettes remain clear.
Color direction: Fire warm oranges/reds, lightning electric yellow-cyan, ice pale cyan/blue/white, poison toxic green/olive.
Quality details: No anti-aliasing blur, hard pixel edges, coherent frame-to-frame motion progression from cast start to impact/fade, game-ready atlas spacing.
Avoid: text, labels, UI, characters, weapons, backgrounds, watercolor, smooth gradients, blurry edges.

rationale: Higher-energy VFX style with stronger motion arcs and impact frames.
prompt:
Pixel-art sprite atlas for a 2D game with four offensive magic spell animations.
Subject: Fireball, lightning strike, ice spike, poison cloud.
Environment: Transparent background only.
Style: 32x32 pixel frames, arcade-style pixel VFX, bold contrast.
Composition: One atlas image in a strict 4x6 grid of frames; each row is one spell in order fireball, lightning strike, ice spike, poison cloud; each row animates left-to-right from cast to peak to dissipate.
Lighting: Strong emissive core with subtle outer aura in pixels.
Color direction: Saturated elemental palettes; fire orange-magenta highlights, lightning yellow-white with cyan fringe, ice blue-white shards, poison green with dark desaturated smoke edges.
Quality details: Distinct keyframes at frames 1, 3, and 6; consistent frame alignment for easy engine import; clean transparent margins.
Avoid: text, logos, character art, perspective scene, painterly strokes, soft airbrush, noisy texture.

rationale: Dark-fantasy palette variant for moodier spell packs and night maps.
prompt:
Create a game-ready pixel sprite atlas of casted spells for a top-down action RPG.
Subject: Fireball, lightning strike, ice spike, poison cloud as separate animation rows.
Environment: Fully transparent background with only sprite pixels.
Style: Handcrafted retro pixel art, 32x32 frame cells, restrained palette, readable at small scale.
Composition: Atlas layout 4 rows by 6 columns with uniform spacing; row order fireball, lightning strike, ice spike, poison cloud; smooth motion continuity in each strip.
Lighting: Dramatic glow cores with darker outer tones for high readability on bright and dark maps.
Color direction: Fire ember-red/orange, lightning pale gold with blue sparks, ice cold teal/white, poison murky lime with dark vapor.
Quality details: Pixel-perfect edges, centered sprites in each cell, no clipping, no stray pixels, export-ready atlas.
Avoid: text, borders, checkerboards, characters, environment props, modern 3D rendering, blur.
